DataElement.preferredName: Person Autologous Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation And Graft Versus Host Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical trial participation that are related to stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is his own donor and graft versus host disease, as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Autologous Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation And Graft Versus Host Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is his own donor._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A reaction, which may be fatal, in an immunocompromised subject (host) who has received an antigenically incompatible tissue transplant (graft) from an immunocompetent donor. The reaction is secondary to the activation of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that express an antigen not expressed by the donor, and is seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation; acute disease is seen after 5-40 days, and chronic disease occurs weeks to months after transplantation.Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Autologous Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation And Graft Versus Host Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is his own donor.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A reaction, which may be fatal, in an immunocompromised subject (host) who has received an antigenically incompatible tissue transplant (graft) from an immunocompetent donor. The reaction is secondary to the activation of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that express an antigen not expressed by the donor, and is seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation; acute disease is seen after 5-40 days, and chronic disease occurs weeks to months after transplantation.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is their own donor.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A reaction, which may be fatal, in an immunocompromised subject (host) who has received an antigenically incompatible tissue transplant (graft) from an immunocompetent donor. The reaction is secondary to the activation of the transplanted cells against those host tissues that express an antigen not expressed by the donor, and is seen most commonly following bone marrow transplantation; acute disease is seen after 5-40 days, and chronic disease occurs weeks to months after transplantation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was last allogeneic stem cell
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was last allogeneic stem cell transplantation done at least 24 weeks prior to starting KRT-232 (AMG 232) + KRd, and these subjects must also NOT have moderate to severe active acute or chronic graft versus host disease (GVHD)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant was it at least 3 months prior to enrollment and does not have evidence of active graft versus host disease or require systemic immune suppression?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient had allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplant, has patient had any graft-versus-host disease within the previous 3 months or requiring immunosuppression?
